result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robin Ellis Braasch

records.addlTxt: 1:28 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: ChristiansonProsecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Robin Ellis Braasch. Defendant Robin Ellis Braasch appeared by video, in custody. Includes 22CM549 and 22CM554. Court reviews case. Court notes Atty appointed. PSC already scheduled. Court makes statements to DE. Adjourned 01:31 PM
to appear via zoom on 09/20 at 1pm. Filed by Atty Schmidt. arc   to ty

1:13 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Robin Ellis Braasch in court. Court reviews file. DE states that he will be going to sober house in Amery, looking to get into treatment facility. Court advises DE to speak with attorney and representative from JSC. Court notes previously scheduled BBH, will consider Zoom appearance if in treatment. Adjourned: 1:19 PM. kma
Bail/bond hearing on September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

3:33 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt appeared by video for Robin Ellis Braasch. Defendant Robin Ellis Braasch not in court. Court reviews case. Court states DE was transported to the Hospital. ADA Ballo states Law Enforcement would perfer not to stay with DE. Atty Schmidt has no objection to signature bond. Court questions what to do after DE is released. Atty Schmidt suggests DE enter a sober living facility or treatment upon discharge from Hospital. Atty Ballo suggests or DE return to Jail. Atty Ballo to contact Corp Counsel to see what options maybe. Court amends bond. Court sets STC. Adjourned 03:39 PM
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Stephanie Schmidt; hereby appointing Atty Schmidt. arc
Bail/bond hearing on September 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:02 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson,  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt and Intern Lanie Krause in court. Robin Braasch in court in custody by video. DE received copy of complaint, confirms address and DOB. NG. DE qualifies for public defender. Intern Krause states there may be a bed available for DE for treatment. Court sets bond. Court sets PSC and BBH.
